title: Impulse - change in momentum from force position

content.description: A student pushes a box of mass <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mstyle></math> from rest in a straight line across a horizontal surface. Friction between the box and the surface is negligible. The student records the applied horizontal force as a function of the position of the box and creates the graph shown in the figure.
content.question: What is the approximate change in the momentum of the box as the box is pushed from <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="x equals 6.0 meters" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>m</mtext> </mstyle> </math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.0 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="6.0 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="12 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="36 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>36</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="12 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
